Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: icarver
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, great location half way between midtown & lower manhattan. Can walk every where or the subway is only 2 mins away. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Our room was excellent & the price was reasonable. Can't fault the place at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Tazbee
Reviews.Content: So thrilled I found this great hotel. Checked in late late at night after a rough day of travel and was given the perfect room. Super comfortable bed. Big fluffy comforter. Skylight but no window but I was only there to sleep and shower so I didn't care. Love the location! Cost was about $200 for one person including taxes. They let me store my bags there for the day after I checked out. Only complaint was that it was warm in the room and the air conditioning was not functional. A fan would have been helpful. Otherwise, I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifica ubicación y servicio”
Reviews.Author: Angeles G
Reviews.Content: Gran hotel y servicio. Great place to stay. I spent 9 nights this February and enjoyed very much. Great people and clean and good size rooms. Spectacular location, my room had a view of 19 street. Loving it. Angeles, Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and clean room”
Reviews.Author: mfcMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Hotel Veritae. It must be fairly newly renovated because the room although small was neat, clean and newer. It had a good bed and a very large flat screen TV. There is no phone in the rooms but it doesn’t’ matter because there is no meal service what so ever. I was on the fourth floor so the subway noise was minimal. I have heard that if you are on the lower floors it can be a bit noisy. My only 2 complaints are that the floor squeaked when I walked on it and I almost ran out of soap the third day there. Fortunately I finally received a new one on my fourth night. The wireless is free but it is spotty, so be aware. Also their pricing policy seems a bit odd. I paid a different rate for different nights midweek. The room was a bit warm but the weather wsa warm so i'm certain they couldn't switch from heat to cooling. All in all it was a good clean room for a very good price in NYC. I’ll go back. Just remember to ask for a room higher up to avoid the subway noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and price”
Reviews.Author: Tiiti
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay near Washington Square Park and Mac Dougal Street but this hotel was even better located for our needs: restaurants and shopping: Filene’s Basement, Nordstrom Rack, Loehmanns, Daffy’s, T.J.Maxx, Marshalls (and so many unique shops) all within walking distance. We really enjoyed the free buffet breakfast because it made all the difference in the mornings. The breakfast consisted of bagels, toast, various pastries, hardboiled eggs, coffee, juice, fruits etc.The common areas are modern and stylish and since it is very small hotel so no crowds nor long waits for elevator. The staff is friendly and helpful. We had a queen room which was big for NYC standards. It had windows towards Broadway but we did not keep the curtains open because we could see people in the opposite building, so I thought they could see us as well The subway was indeed very loud but we always travel with earplugs so it did’t bother us. Room was modern except the carpet which I think looked worn. I really enjoyed the new linen, comforter, pillows and bed which was quite firm. We are used to memory foam mattresses at home so this was good for us. I got to see the room with two beds and it looked really nice and spacious. I would book that for our next visit if I got a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Safe and clean”
Reviews.Author: Jewtah
Reviews.Content: First of all, the place is safe and clean, no bedbugs that i saw. Yes, there is subway noise, and my room had no window, it was a black hole....But i got it for $115 a night. I was quite pleased by the experience. During my stay there were several people screaming at the front desk people, and i take it they paid substantially more than i did.... If i had paid $300 or so i would have been very much less pleased by the place!! This is just not a $300 a night place! The location if fine if you are a east side/downtown kind of person....its not so easy to get to the west side in midtown. So it all depends, but if you are paying in the higher range you probably won't be as pleased as i was...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: sgtmother
Reviews.Content: I agree with the reivew by "montepink" -- the location is great and the beds are wonderful -- really firm mattresses, good pillows, really nice sheets and covers, but our room faced Broadway and I needed earplugs to sleep due to street and subway noise. The interior rooms are probably a lot quieter. The hotel itself inside was very quiet -- we never heard any other guests. The bathroom in our room lacked a decent sized shelf for cosmetics, etc., but my son who only uses a toothbrush and paste was fine. I needed to ask for more soap which I found a bit annoying. Good fluffy towels. There is no coffee in the room, but it is available in the lobby. They give you one, small bottle of Fiji water which I thought was going to be a daily thing, but it was not to be. The hidef TV was good.

Reviews.Title: “Flies in the bathroom, mold on the ceiling - and no heat!!”
Reviews.Author: Peter A
Reviews.Content: Things didn't start off well at Hotel Verite. I made my reservation through Booking.com. When I arrived at the hotel, the woman at the front desk reported that they'd 'just received the fax' from the booking site. The fax? What is this, 1993? Shouldn't this be done by, you know, computer? Apparently, the room that I'd booked for two nights was only available for one night. The front desk lady tried to convince me to take the room for one night, then switch to another room the next night. I allowed as how I'd prefer one room for two nights, as that's what I'd booked. After several minutes she simply offered me the second night's room for both nights. "Why didn't you just give me that in the first place?" I inquired. "That room is larger - the room you reserved is smaller." This was at 6:30 in the evening. Perhaps they were waiting for someone to make a last minute, one-night reservation for the larger room...but it struck me as just poor customer service. So, 'upgraded' to the larger room, I settled in. I went to the bathroom, and noticed some sort of fly on the mirror. Oh, and there's another by the sink. And another on the shower curtain. I'm not one to make a fuss, so I killed four of the insects and went on about my business. However, the flies (or whatever they were) seemed to return in groups of three or four throughout my stay. It wasn't until I was in bed that night that I noticed the dripping noise from the floor above...and the water damage to a corner of the ceiling...and the black mold growing there. Of course I reported all this to the front desk, and they were very polite and apologetic, and even sent someone up to look, but apparently there was nothing to be done. All of which would have been more or less harmless, had it not been in the low teens in NYC last night. The room had no heat. I got back to the hotel around 9pm and reported the heat problem. Then again around 11pm when it wasn't any better. Then around 5am when the cold woke me up, despite assurances that they'd fixed the problem. I finally decided to get out, shower somewhere warmer (the gym) and take my leave of the Hotel Verite. They were kind enough to credit me for the heat-less night...but I cannot recommend this hotel to others. Two stars because the staff was always polite and generally seemed to be trying to help - just with very little success.

Reviews.Title: “Location and Noise”
Reviews.Author: montepink
Reviews.Content: A very decent hotel (beds, linen, cleanliness) in a great location, but rooms facing Broadway get a lot (and I mean a lot) of noise from the subway. As normally IN the subway you have to wait for a train forever and from your ROOM you can hear a train passing every minute, this is ironic. I guess this is because Union Square is just a few blocks away and several subway lines use the same under-Broadway tunnel. The sound may seem romantic for some, I suppose, but if you are a light sleeper, beware.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: TanyAlias
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights on a work trip and the location was great. It is a small and intimate boutique hotel, with some nice features (you use your key card to turn on the lights). The lobby was greatly appreciated as a nice space to read, drink coffee, flip through magazines--very zen. The staff was very pleasant. Very close to some good subway lines to get around everywhere I needed to go both up and downtown. Close to some good restaurants and bars and plenty of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place”
Reviews.Author: Janet V
Reviews.Content: A quick visit to NY for a wedding on LI-stayed one night at Verite and it was relaxing and beautiful. Very helpful staff-a booking snafu didn't accommodate my family of 5. The staff quickly changed our reservation and didn't charge me-even though it was through no fault of theirs. It's a lovely place-the bed is a little hard, but not completely uncomfortable. We walked to Union Square and ate well. I'd like to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location with Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: LM40
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week as a family of 5. Hotel is small and intimate. Staff were lovely, very helpful and attended to requests immediately. We called reception for an extra blanket and it was delivered within minutes. Room was modern and very big for NY standards. 2 large beds plus a leather look, pull out, futon style sofa bed. Large bathroom, huge plasma TV. Other reviews have complained about beds too hard and subway noise - beds ARE firm but still comfortable and you do hear the trains below you BUT neither of these things kept us awake - we always slept soundly. location is fantastic - around the corner from Union Station and 2 stops from Times Square. The "Hop on Hop off" bus stops around the corner as well. You have a view of the Empire State Building as you walk from Union Station to the hotel. Restaurants and supermarkets are also around the corner. We booked this hotel because they offered a complimentary breakfast daily, however, the breakfast service had ceased a few months before our stay. Because the hotel had not updated their website and removed the breakfast information they immediately told us we would happily refunded a percentage of our stay upon checkout, which they did graciously. Only a few little things to criticize - not a lot of cupboard space for 5 people even though our room could have accommodated another cupboard. Toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, soap) were not replenished each day and some days we would only get 4 towels instead of 5. Oh, and no wash cloths / face washers which I'm told is common in NY hotels - with 3 children I needed face washers. Overall, a really good stay, I would definitely stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone :0)

Reviews.Title: “Best of Boutique in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Emoskimo
Reviews.Content: Hotel Verite is what you are hoping for when you book a boutique hotel. Perfect location, great rates, warm staff, and clean/comfortable accommodations. I was thinking of not reviewing this place because I wanted to keep it my NYC secret, but im sure it will become very popular. Their rates go from $275 to $330 for a queen single room (which is an unusually low rate for clean hotels in this area). The LOCATION is perfect. A 10 minute walk from Grand Central Station and/or where the Bolt Bus drops you off, and a 5 minute walk to Union Square (where you'll find an excellent farmer's market on Saturday mornings). Subways surround the hotel, and tons of shopping including Macy's, Banana Republic, Armani Exchange, etc. are within 5 minutes walking distance. If you feel like walking, you can get to Times Square in 30 minutes (or a cheap cab ride or subway). The ACCOMMODATIONS were impressive. I noticed people reviewed that the beds were hard. This is because the beds are top-quality Tempur-Pedic / Foam which is expensive and very good for your back. You may not be used to it, but it is the way to go. All feather/down blankets and pillows. VERY MODERN bathroom with tile walls, glass shower and raindrop showerhead. The only drawback (that my Fiance mainly had a problem with) was there was no full-length mirror in our queen single room... The staff was very accommodating from the start. They will hold your bags before/after checkout in a secure, locked room. They could not have been friendlier, and were very responsive to accommodate my down/fur allergy. This hotel was built 6 months ago, so everything is modern and brand-new. I am hoping they keep the rates where they are at...and this will remain an awesome find in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “So So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pulleyo
Reviews.Content: The Location is good and the Room was clean, so far the good Things. The Room had nÃ¶ real window, only in the ceiling, which should Be at least mentioned when you Book the Room. For a Three Star Place Not Bad, but there are better options at their Price Level in the City. I paid almost Three hundred USD per Night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful facilities, wonderful staff, and great location!”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter456
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August 2011 with my friends in celebrating my birthday in New York City. Location: in the heart of Union Square - right near some great shopping - H&M, Express, Banana Republic, Forever 21, Whole Foods, just to name a few--and also right near the subway (if you're concerned about late night transportation) and many eateries. The "downside": I've been reading that many of the reviews complain about the noise. But honestly, you're in the middle of New York City. Anywhere you sleep is bound to be surrounded by noise. It's kind of naive to think that you can find a quiet sleep in New York. Come on! It's the city that never sleeps! Staff--the staff is very accomodating, welcoming, and very sweet. I have to say that were the friendliest bunch I've met. Facilities-- the bed was very comfortable! I don't know why I'm reading reviews on how "hard" the bed was. Not to mention that a "hard" bed is better for your back than a soft one. Shower pressure is phenomenal. Nice TV, Very very clean facilities. They also delivered me a bouquet of flowers for my birthday. Now, what hotel does that?! =)

Reviews.Title: “The most uncomfortable bed in the world”
Reviews.Author: mudloft
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was good, and the decor was very plush, but the bed was so hard it was almost like sleeping on the floor. There were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and at breakfast there was no hot water available, so we had to go to a Deli to get a cup of tea. We felt this was a bit poor for a three star hotel!.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: F-14D
Reviews.Content: As a first-time visitor to Manhattan I was apprehensive, but this hotel was very clean and nicely located for our itinerary. Our room looked out on Broadway, although not a very active or attractive section of it. It is just a short walk from the Flatiron building and nice views of the Empire State Building and the Met Life building, and just a block past that to the subway and underground parking. We could hear each and every subway train roll by underneath Broadway, but it was not unpleasant or disruptive to our sleep. Our man Diego was attentive to all our requests. As of this writing they have not re-opened their restaurant.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Verite
HotelInfo.Address: 13 E. 19th Street, & 893 Broadway, New York City, NY 10003
